docs.lead_paragraph: The party-line vote put on display an unusual alliance between some Democrats and Republicans on the role of Congress in deciding to go into battle.
docs.snippet: The party-line vote put on display an unusual alliance between some Democrats and Republicans on the role of Congress in deciding to go into battle....
docs.abstract: Senate Foreign Relations Committee votes to authorize military campaign against Islamic State; 10-to-8 vote illuminates unexpected alliance between some Democrats and some Republicans in debate over role of Congress in making and approving decision to go to war.

headline.print_headline: Senate Panel Approves Limited ISIS Fight, Reviving War Powers Debate
headline.main: Senate Panel Approves Limited Fight Against ISIS, Reopening War Powers Debate

docs.lead_paragraph: New Jersey voters say the rest of the United States is not ready for a "Jersey Guy" president and neither is the Garden State, where Governor Chris Christie's presidential appeal continues to slide, a poll released on Thursday showed.

headline.main: New Jersey Voters Say U.S. Not Ready for President 'Jersey Guy' Christie: Poll

docs.lead_paragraph: Most of the presumptive presidential candidates have not plunged into Washington’s debate over the Senate Intelligence Committee’s withering report on the C.I.A.’s brutal interrogation tactics.

byline.contributor: Sheryl Gay Stolberg reported from Washington, and Michael Barbaro from New York. Reporting was contributed by Jonathan Martin, Ashley Parker, Amy Chozick, Jeremy W. Peters and Trip Gabriel.
byline.original: By SHERYL GAY STOLBERG and MICHAEL BARBARO

docs.snippet: Most of the presumptive presidential candidates have not plunged into Washington’s debate over the Senate Intelligence Committee’s withering report on the C.I.A.’s brutal interrogation tactics....
docs.abstract: Most presumptive 2016 presidential candidates have declined to weigh in on Senate Intelligence Committee’s withering report on CIA's brutal interrogation tactics, illustrating delicate politics of national security; few want to be seen as defending torture, particularly in aftermath of graphic techniques depicted in panel’s findings, and yet, at same time, they do not want to be seen as soft on terrorism.

headline.print_headline: Torture Report Puts Politicians in Quiet Mode
headline.main: Torture Report Puts Presidential Hopefuls in Quiet Mode

docs.snippet: Gov. Martin O’Malley of Maryland, a Democrat who is considering a run for president, condemned the C.I.A.’s use of torture as described in a Senate report, staking out a position to the left of the party’s favorite, Hillary Rodham Clinton....
docs.abstract: Gov. Martin O’Malley of Maryland, a Democrat who is considering a run for president, condemned the C.I.A.’s use of torture as described in a Senate report, staking out a position to the left of the party’s favorite, Hillary Rodham Clinton.

headline.main: On Torture, O'Malley Stands to the Left of Clinton

docs.lead_paragraph: The museum plans a $325 million, six-story addition along Columbus Avenue to accommodate its expanding role as a center for research and education.
docs.snippet: The museum plans a $325 million, six-story addition along Columbus Avenue to accommodate its expanding role as a center for research and education....
docs.abstract: American Museum of Natural History is planning a $325 million, six-story addition along Columbus Avenue to accommodate its expanding role as center for scientific research and education; addition, called Richard Gilder Center for Science, Education and Innovation, is to be completed by 2019, museum's 150th anniversary.

headline.print_headline: Museum Plans to Expand Site, and Its Mission
headline.main: American Museum of Natural History Plans an Addition

docs.lead_paragraph: The Republican Trey Gowdy, chairman of the special House committee created to investigate the 2012 attacks in Libya, said “we should not move on” until more questions are answered.
docs.snippet: The Republican Trey Gowdy, chairman of the special House committee created to investigate the 2012 attacks in Libya, said “we should not move on” until more questions are answered....
docs.abstract: Republican Rep Trey Gowdy of South Carolina, chairman of special House panel investigating 2012 terrorist attacks on diplomatic mission in Benghazi, Libya, says he supports continuing probe despite calls to abandon effort.

docs.lead_paragraph: The State Department has failed to turn over government documents covering Hillary Rodham Clinton's tenure as secretary of state that The Associated Press and others requested under the U.S. Freedom of Information Act ahead of her presumptive presidential campaign. They include one request AP made four years ago and others pending for more than one year.

headline.print_headline: Delays Plague Hillary Clinton's State Dept. Files
headline.main: Delays Plague Hillary Clinton's State Dept. Files
